It's official - we have a game.

Scotland will take on Japan in the Rugby World Cup today and know they must win to stand any chance of progression.

The Scots need to take four more points than the host nation to progress, meaning if they claim victory without a bonus point and Japan lose by seven points or less, they will crash out.

A draw or a defeat will see them eliminated regardless - but the situation is now in Scotland's hands after World Cup bosses gave the game the green light amid the chaos of Typhoon Hagibis.

Here's all you need to know ahead of the game...

(Image: Getty Images)

When is Scotland vs Japan?

Scotland will take on Japan at 11.45am in Yokohama.

Where can I watch it?

The match will be broadcast live on ITV and can be live streamed through the ITV Player.

(Image: World Rugby via Getty Images)

Team news

Japan: Tupou, Matsushima, Lafaele, Nakamura, Fukuoka, Tamura, Nagare, Inagaki, Horie, Koo, Thompson, Moore, Leitch, Labuschagne, Himeno

Scotland: Hogg, Seymour, Harris, Johnson, Graham, Russell, Laidlaw, Dell, Brown, Nel, Gilchrist, Gray, Bradbury, Ritchie, Thomson

Betting odds

Japan: 7/5

Draw: 20/1

Scotland: 8/11
